{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/title | put}}
{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/navbar}}
{{ddcl |
basic_ostream&amp; put( char_type ch );
}}

Behaves as an {{named req|UnformattedOutputFunction}}. After constructing and checking the sentry object, writes the character {{tt|ch}} to the output stream.

If the output fails for any reason, sets {{tt|badbit}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | ch | character to write}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

===Notes===
This function is not overloaded for the types {{c|signed char}} or {{c|unsigned char}}, unlike the formatted {{rlp|operator_ltlt2|operator&lt;&lt;}}.

Unlike formatted output functions, this function does not set the {{tt|failbit}} if the output fails.

===Example===
{{example
 | code=
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout.put('a'); // normal usage
    std::cout.put('\n');

    std::ofstream s("/does/not/exist/");
    s.clear(); // pretend the stream is good
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Unformatted output: ";
    s.put('c'); // this will set badbit, but not failbit
    std::cout &lt;&lt; " fail=" &lt;&lt; bool(s.rdstate() &amp; s.failbit);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; " bad=" &lt;&lt; s.bad() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    s.clear();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Formatted output:   ";
    s &lt;&lt; 'c'; // this will set badbit and failbit
    std::cout &lt;&lt; " fail=" &lt;&lt; bool(s.rdstate() &amp; s.failbit);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; " bad=" &lt;&lt; s.bad() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 | output=
a
Unformatted output:  fail=0 bad=1
Formatted output:    fail=1 bad=1 &lt;!-- note: few compilers implement this correctly. Works in CLang++ --&gt;
}}
